document_title: Gastric mucosal inflammation: Causes, symptoms and treatments
subsection_name: viem-niem-mac-da-day.json_6_Nutrition for people with gastric mucosal inflammation
subsection_content:
Daily diet directly affects the process of recovering damage to the stomach lining. Therefore, patients need to pay attention to choosing appropriate foods.
1. What should you eat if you have inflammation of the stomach lining?
Patients should prioritize certain foods to help control stomach mucosa inflammation and uncomfortable symptoms. Specifically includes:
Foods rich in fiber: Whole grains, green vegetables, beans, fruits, vegetables...; Low-fat foods: Fish, green vegetables, lean meat...; Foods containing low acid concentrations: Vegetables, beans...; The drink does not contain gas or caffeine.; Foods containing Probiotics: Yogurt, kimchi, probiotics...
2. What should you avoid if you have inflammation of the stomach lining?
An unhealthy diet will make inflammation of the stomach lining more serious. Specifically, patients should avoid or minimize the consumption of the following harmful foods:
Acidic foods: Tomatoes, some fruits...; Wine.; Carbonated beverage.; Coffee.; Fatty foods.; Fried foods.; Various types of fruit juices.; Pickled and pickled foods; Spicy and hot food; Tea.
In addition, if the patient notices that any certain food or food group makes inflammation symptoms worse, stop using it immediately. This may bring many positive improvements to the medical condition.
